blocks.value: Saint Luke was a physician and a Gentile convert who became a close companion of Saint Paul. He is the author of both the Gospel of Luke and the Acts of the Apostles, making him the most prolific New Testament writer.

Luke's Gospel emphasizes God's mercy and Jesus' love for the poor, outcasts, and sinners. It contains beloved parables like the Good Samaritan and the Prodigal Son, and gives special attention to the Blessed Mother.

Tradition holds that Luke painted icons of the Blessed Virgin Mary. He is the patron saint of physicians, surgeons, artists, and historians. His careful research and attention to detail make his writings invaluable historical documents of early Christianity.
